resources.string: Find a number on your item inside a recycling symbol, like this:
A recycling symbol with a 4 inside, captioned LDPE.

How2Recycle is an application that helps you identify different recyclable materials and how to recycle them. Not all materials are equal, believe it or not! Some materials like cardboard can be recycled in household recycling bins, while others, such as batteries or special plastics, must be taken to special centers. By inputting the recycling code (a number found on most recyclable items) into our app, the app informs you of information about the material as well as where to recycle it. \n\nThis app was developed by Daniel Oviedo, Sam Marshak, and WriterArtistCoder. The project was supervised by Sebastian Troncoso. We are middle-high school computer science students from The League of Amazing Programmers in San Diego, CA. This app was our community group project, the final project before taking the Java Oracle Exam and graduating from the League of Amazing Programmers (https://jointheleague.org).
